title: On-street charging is the key to creating a sustainable, green economy
lead: Neil Isaacson, Liberty Charge CEO, examines how to enable on-street charging at scale and how this will help create a green economy.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Ofgem to consult on DUoS charge timeline in light of RIIO-ED2
lead: ​Ofgem has launched a consultation into temporarily changing the current distribution use of system (DUoS) charge notification periods.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: GenGame to develop home and public EV charging app with simplified payments
lead: ​A Home & Roam charging solution is under development in a collaboration between GenGame, Paua Tech and Evergreen Energy.
author: Alice Grundy

title: UK will fall short of 2050 emissions targets, majority of energy professionals believe
lead: A report has found that 85% of UK energy professionals believe the government will fall short of its 2050 emissions reduction goal.
author: Alice Grundy

title: FES: Britain could reach net zero by 2047 with a ‘coordinated approach’
lead: ​National Grid ESO’s Future Energy Scenarios (FES) 2021 outline four different, credible pathways for the future of energy in Britain, details the transformation of the energy mix and flexibility, the residential sector and the transport sector.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Ecotricity eyes Good Energy takeover
lead: ​Ecotricity is to potentially make a bid for Good Energy, having made three indicative offers in the past month.
author: Alice Grundy

title: FES 2021: Urgent policy decisions pivotal to reaching net zero
lead: ​Changes to consumer behaviour and policy clarity will be pivotal to achieving net zero in the UK.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Siemens teams up with Oracle for Half Hourly Settlement data processing solution
lead: ​Siemens has joined forces with global strategic cloud provider Oracle to offer energy suppliers a high-performance processing solution.
author: Alice Grundy

title: UK ranked sixth in the world for solar and wind generation
lead: ​The UK has been ranked sixth in the world for solar and wind power generation, according to thinktank Ember's Global Electricity Review.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Wind and solar generation grow despite 4.5% global primary energy consumption drop
lead: ​2020 saw the largest annual decline in primary energy consumption since 1945, with a drop of 4.5%, according to BP’s Statistical Review of World Energy 2021.
author: Alice Grundy

title: ENA launches streamlined network connection process for EVs and heat pumps
lead: ​A new, streamlined process for connecting electric vehicles (EVs) and heat pumps to electricity networked has been launched.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: BEIS targets 42.1GW for T-4 2025/26 Capacity Market auction
lead: ​The target for the T-4 2025/26 Capacity Market auction is to remain broadly in line with its predecessors, while the T-1 2022/23 target has risen compared to 2021/22.
author: Alice Grundy

title: COP26 Presidency programme includes day dedicated to energy
lead: ​The UK has released the Presidency programme for the upcoming COP26 summit in Glasgow, with a day dedicated to energy.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: 'Significant' cost reductions needed for green hydrogen as grid-connected electrolysers deemed more costly
lead: Green hydrogen production costs in Europe could fall to between €2 (£1.72) and €2.5/kg, but hydrogen produced by grid electricity will drive up costs.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Energy Systems Catapult seeks views on barriers to demand-side flexibility
lead: ​The Energy Systems Catapult, alongside advisory firm CEPA, is to carry out a new study on energy price signals.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Flexion Energy secures £150m GLIL investment to fund 300MW battery portfolio
lead: ​GLIL Infrastructure has invested £150 million into Flexion Energy, a joint venture with ion Ventures aiming to build 1GW of storage over five years.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Limejump’s platform passes 1.5GW as volatility remains in power prices
lead: ​Limejump’s power platform has passed 1.5GW of capacity for the first time since the company was established in 2013.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Q&A: GRIDSERVE's Toddington Harper on taking on the Electric Highway
lead: ​Current± caught up with GRIDSERVE CEO Toddington Harper to discuss the acquisition, the funding required for its next steps and how the company is navigating the "real challenges" of COVID-19 and Brexit.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Green energy growth could mitigate 90% of COVID-19 job losses
lead: A pipeline of 540 green energy projects in the UK could ad 43GW of generation capacity and create more than 430,000 clean jobs, largely mitigating job losses caused by COVID-19, a new report has claimed.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Pure Planet to offer EV charging insights with app expansion
lead: ​Pure Planet and BP are launching a new digital service allowing households and drivers to see the financial cost and emissions of personal energy use.
author: Alice Grundy
